debug_option.description: Indicate to TZ that Secure Watchdog Access is enabled.
Permit collection of full PD Dump of DSP Dynamic User PDs.
Permit module signature verification bypass in DSP Dynamic User PDs.
Permit DSP Dynamic user PDs to be created as a critical process.
Indicate to AOP that Secure Watchdog Access is enabled.
Permit collection of full PD Dump of DSP Dynamic User PDs.
Permit module signature verification bypass in DSP Dynamic User PDs.
Permit DSP Dynamic user PDs to be created as a critical process.

fuse.name: OEM_ROOT_CERT_ACTIVATION_LIST_0
fuse.description: Activate root0 cert.

fuse.name: OEM_ROOT_CERT_ACTIVATION_LIST_1
fuse.description: Activate root1 cert.

fuse.name: OEM_ROOT_CERT_ACTIVATION_LIST_2
fuse.description: Activate root2 cert.

fuse.name: OEM_ROOT_CERT_ACTIVATION_LIST_3
fuse.description: Activate root3 cert.

fuse.name: OEM_ROOT_CERT_REVOCATION_LIST_0
fuse.description: Revoke root0 cert.

fuse.name: OEM_ROOT_CERT_REVOCATION_LIST_1
fuse.description: Revoke root1 cert.

fuse.name: OEM_ROOT_CERT_REVOCATION_LIST_2
fuse.description: Revoke root2 cert.

fuse.name: OEM_ROOT_CERT_REVOCATION_LIST_3
fuse.description: Revoke root3 cert.

fuse.name: DISALLOW_SOC_DEBUG
fuse.description: DisallowSOCDEBUG '1' - Disallow unlocking of debug interfaces for the entire SoC (i.e. no SoC debug possible permanently). Requires Activate_Security_Policy fuse set to '1' to take effect. Not recommended. No RMA /JTAG access possible. '0' - debugging is available.

fuse.name: ENFORCE_OEM_AUTHZ_ON_SOC_DEBUG
fuse.description: EnforceOemAuthzOnSocDebug '1' - Enforce OEM authorization of Debug Policy Requests. When set, OEM must counter-sign Qti debug policies and TME must verify both signatures (Qti and OEM). Requires Activate_Security_Policy fuse set to '1' to take effect. '0' - Do not enforce OEM counter-signing.

fuse.name: ENFORCE_OEM_AUTHZ_ON_FUSE_OVERRIDES
fuse.description: EnforceOemAuthzOnFuseOverrides '1' - Fuse overwrite request requires an OEM signature. Requires Activate_Security_Policy fuse set to '1' to take effect. '0' - Fuse overwrite request does not require an OEM signature.

fuse.name: ENFORCE_OEM_AUTHZ_ON_ROM_PATCH
fuse.description: EnforceOemAuthzOnROMPatch '1' - Updates to TME/SoC ROM (RoT) requires OEM signature. Requires Activate_Security_Policy fuse set to '1' to take effect. '0' - Updates to TME/SoC ROM (RoT) do not require OEM signature.

fuse.name: ACTIVATE_SECURITY_POLICY
fuse.description: ActivateSecurityPolicy Set to '1' for OEMSecurityPolicy bits 0,1,4,5 to take effect.

fuse.name: OEM_DEVICE_LCS
fuse.description: OEM_DEVICE_LCS (OEM Device Life cycle state) 01 => OEM_DEV_LCSID 00,1X => OEM_PROD_LCSID.

fuse.name: OEM_ALL_DEBUG_DISABLE_FUSE
fuse.description: With this bit the OEM indicates that the device cannot be moved into debug state regardless of signed debug commands. All debug is disabled with this bit set.

fuse.name: AUTH_EN
fuse.description: Blow this bit to enable secure boot for apps and other peripheral images. When this bit is '1'; enables authentication for any code that references secure boot configuration.

fuse.name: PK_HASH_IN_FUSE
fuse.description: For boot configuration : - If this bit is '0' use the internal ROM hash index and OEM_SECURE_BOOT1_ROM_PK_HASH_IDX[3:0] for the root certificate hash. - If this bit is '1' use the value stored in OEM_PK_HASH for the root certificate hash.

fuse.name: USE_SERIAL_NUM
fuse.description: If this bit is '1' then the unique device serial number is required in the authentication of code for boot configuration.

fuse.name: ROM_PK_HASH_IDX
fuse.description: If PK_HASH_IN_FUSE = '0'; this value selects which root certificate hash to use from the ROM table.

fuse.name: MRC_WRITE_DISABLE
fuse.description: This bit determines the write permission setting for this region.

fuse.name: OEM_SECURITY_POLICY_WRITE_DISABLE
fuse.description: Disables further QFPROM changes to OEM SECURITY POLICY region. Blow this bit after the OEM SECURITY POLICY region has been completely provisioned.

fuse.name: WRITE_PERMISSIONS_WRITE_DISABLE
fuse.description: Disables further QFPROM changes to WRITE PERMISSIONS region. Blow this bit only if no further changes to Write Permissions are needed.

fuse.name: READ_PERMISSIONS_WRITE_DISABLE
fuse.description: Disables further QFPROM changes to READ PERMISSIONS region. Blow this bit after the READ PERMISSIONS region has been completely provisioned.

fuse.name: FUSE_REDUNDANCY_ENABLE_WRITE_DISABLE
fuse.description: Disables further QFPROM changes to FUSE REDUNDANCY ENABLE region. Blow this bit after the FUSE REDUNDANCY ENABLE region has been completely provisioned.

fuse.name: DEBUG_DISABLE_WRITE_DISABLE
fuse.description: Disables further QFPROM changes to DEBUG DISABLE region. Blow this bit after the DEBUG DISABLE region has been completely provisioned.

fuse.name: OEM_CONFIG_WRITE_DISABLE
fuse.description: Disables further QFPROM changes to OEM CONFIG region. Blow this bit after the OEM CONFIG region has been completely provisioned.

fuse.name: ANTI_ROLLBACK_WRITE_DISABLE
fuse.description: This bit determines the write permission setting for this region.

fuse.name: MRC_HASH_WRITE_DISABLE
fuse.description: Disables further QFPROM changes to MRC HASH region. Blow this bit after the MRC HASH region has been completely provisioned.

fuse.name: OEM_PRODUCT_SEED_WRITE_DISABLE
fuse.description: Disables further QFPROM changes to OEM PRODUCT SEED region. Blow this bit after the OEM PRODUCT SEED region has been completely provisioned.

fuse.name: OEM_SPARE_0_WRITE_DISABLE
fuse.description: Disables further QFPROM changes to OEM SPARE 0 region. Blow this bit after the OEM SPARE 0 region has been completely provisioned.

fuse.name: OEM_SPARE_1_WRITE_DISABLE
fuse.description: Disables further QFPROM changes to OEM SPARE 1 region. Blow this bit after the OEM SPARE 1 region has been completely provisioned.

fuse.name: OEM_SPARE_2_WRITE_DISABLE
fuse.description: Disables further QFPROM changes to OEM SPARE 2 region. Blow this bit after the OEM SPARE 2 region has been completely provisioned.

fuse.name: OEM_SPARE_3_WRITE_DISABLE
fuse.description: Disables further QFPROM changes to OEM SPARE 3 region. Blow this bit after the OEM SPARE 3 region has been completely provisioned.

fuse.name: MRC_READ_DISABLE
fuse.description: This bit determines the write permission setting for this region.

fuse.name: OEM_PRODUCT_SEED_READ_DISABLE
fuse.description: Blow this bit after the OEM Product Seed region has been completely provisioned.

fuse.name: MRC_HASH_FEC_ENABLE
fuse.description: Blow to enable FEC for MRC Hash region. Ensure that complete region is provisioned before FEC is enabled.

fuse.name: OEM_PRODUCT_SEED_FEC_ENABLE
fuse.description: Blow to enable FEC for OEM Product Seed region. Ensure that complete region is provisioned before FEC is enabled.

fuse.name: MSS_MODEM_DBGEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Modem Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: MSS_MODEM_NIDEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Modem Non-Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: QSEE_DBGEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: QSEE Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: QSEE_NIDEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: QSEE Non-Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: PIMEM_DBGEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: PIMEM Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: PIMEM_NIDEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: PIMEM Non-Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: APPS_DBGEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Apps Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: APPS_NIDEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: Apps Non-Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: MSS_SCALAR_DBGEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: MSS Scalar Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: MSS_SCALAR_NIDEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: MSS Scalar Non-Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: DAN_OEM_TRACE_DISABLE
fuse.description: OEM Trace Disable for DAN.

fuse.name: QDSS_TRACE_DISABLE
fuse.description: OEM Trace Disable for QDSS.

fuse.name: Q6_TRACE_DISABLE
fuse.description: OEM Trace Disable for Q6 FAPI.

fuse.name: ECPRI_TRACE_DISABLE
fuse.description: OEM Trace Disable for ECPRI.

fuse.name: ETHERNET_TRACE_DISABLE
fuse.description: OEM Trace Disable for ETHERNET.

fuse.name: DDRSS_DBGEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: DDRSS Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: DDRSS_NIDEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: DDRSS Non-Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: DAP_DBGEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: DAP Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: DAP_NIDEN_DISABLE
fuse.description: DAP Non-Invasive debug disable.

fuse.name: APPS_SCANDUMP_DISABLE
fuse.description: Apps Scan Dump disable.

fuse.name: DDRSS_SCANDUMP_DISABLE
fuse.description: DDRSS Scan Dump disable.

fuse.name: DEBUGBUS_DISABLE
fuse.description: Debug bus disable.

fuse.name: DCC_DISABLE
fuse.description: DCC disable.

fuse.name: SMMU_SCANDUMP_DISABLE
fuse.description: SMMU Scan Dump disable.

fuse.name: E_DLOAD_DISABLE
fuse.description: OEM Optional. Disables emergency download via removable SD and/or USB downloader in Apps PBL error handler.

fuse.name: ENUM_TIMEOUT
fuse.description: OEM Optional. BOOT ROM must support USB enumeration timeout. Timeout applies to both enumeration for FLCB (fast low current boot) and USB download mode. If USB is not enumerated within time (90 seconds), quit USB enumeration If USB suspend or disconnected after enumeration, start timer again.

fuse.name: FORCE_DLOAD_DISABLE
fuse.description: OEM optional. If FORCE_DLOAD_DISABLE is '0'; device goes to download mode if an error occurs very early in XBL1. If FORCE_DLOAD_DISABLE is set to '1'; device goes into cold boot if an error occurs very early in XBL1.

fuse.name: FORCE_USB_BOOT_GPIO_DISABLE
fuse.description: This fuse is used to control booting from FORCE_USB_BOOT_GPIO. It only controls FORCE_USB_GPIO based boot, FDL cookies are not controlled by this fuse. If fuse value = 0 => PBL honors boot from USB if FORCE_USB_BOOT GPIO is flipped. If the GPIO is set to high, PBL will enter USB FEDL path irrespective of FAST_BOOT option selected. If fuse value = 1 => PBL will not enter USB FEDL mode even if FORCE_USB_GPIO is flipped to 1. Boot from FORCE USB GPIO is disabled.

fuse.name: SDCC_ADMA_DISABLE
fuse.description: 0 is default ADMA mode enabled 1 - ADMA mode disabled and fallback to FIFO mode.

fuse.name: FAST_BOOT
fuse.description: These fuses are used by boot code to specify which device has priority to be booted from. For Lassen, the mapping is as follows: 0: eMMC -> USB 1: eMMC + Network -> USB 2: PCIe 3: QSPI NOR + Network -> USB 4: eMMC -> USB 5: NAND -> USB 6: NAND + Network -> USB 7: USB 8: RSVD 9: RSVD.

fuse.name: PBL_QSPI_BOOT_EDL_ENABLED
fuse.description: When fuse is blown, EDL Path will be QSPI->SD->USB else the EDL path will be as before SD->USB.

fuse.name: SPI_CLK_BOOT_FREQ
fuse.description: Default is 37.5 MHz and when blown 19.2 MHz.

fuse.name: PBL_FDL_TIMEOUT_RESET_FEATURE_ENABLE
fuse.description: Fuse bit to reset device if PBL enters into EDL mode unintentionally.

fuse.name: WDOG_EN
fuse.description: Combined with GPIO Wdog disable (connects to MPM). Prevents the Watch Dog from being disabled by the GPIO.

fuse.name: PBL_LOG_DISABLE
fuse.description: SW only use for Boot. Control logging mechanism in Boot ROM (If blown, Logging is disabled & mandated for external parts).

fuse.name: PBL_USB_TYPE_C_DISABLE
fuse.description: 0: QMP PHY receives CC_OUT (0 SS Lane1 or 1 SS Lane2) 1: QMP PHY receives 0 due to PORT SELECT MUX s default value 0 selects SS Lane1.

fuse.name: ROOT_CERT_TOTAL_NUM
fuse.description: Defines the total root cert number supported from the certificate (Upto 4 roots).

fuse.name: QSPI_DMA_DISABLE
fuse.description: 0 => QSPI DMA is enabled 1 => QSPI DMA is disabled.

fuse.name: USB_SS_DISABLE
fuse.description: Used to disable USB SS enumeration during Boot.

fuse.name: SRIS_EN
fuse.description: Enables PCIe SRIS (Separate Reference Clock with Independent SSC) mode.

fuse.name: DEBUG_POLICY_DISABLE
fuse.description: Debug Policy is bypassed when this bit is 1. Debug Policy provides a means to re-enable debug capabilities under OEM-specified selectable conditions.

fuse.name: PBL_FDL_TIMEOUT_RESET_TO_VAL
fuse.description: This fuse allows OEMs to have configurable timeout values for FDL timeout reset feature. 00: 05 ms (default) 01: 30 ms 10: 60 ms 11: 120 ms.

fuse.name: PCIE_SUBSYS_ID
fuse.description: PCIe Subsystem ID. Both PCIE_SUBSYS_ID and PCIE_SUBSYS_VENDOR_ID need blown to a non-zero value to take effect.

fuse.name: PCIE_SUBSYS_VENDOR_ID
fuse.description: PCIe Subsystem Vendor ID. Both PCIE_SUBSYS_ID and PCIE_SUBSYS_VENDOR_ID need blown to a non-zero value to take effect.

fuse.name: TZ_SW_CRYPTO_FIPS_ENABLE
fuse.description: Enable FIPS mode for TZ software crypto. Disable by default and blow to enable.

fuse.name: MODEM_CRYPTO_FIPS_ENABLE
fuse.description: Enable FIPS mode for modem. Disable by default and blow to enable.

fuse.name: TZ_SW_CRYPTO_FIPS_OVERRIDE
fuse.description: Override TZ_SW_CRYPTO_FIPS_ENABLE fuse. Non-override by default and blow to override the TZ_SW_CRYPTO_FIPS_ENABLE fuse to disable the FIPS feature in TZ.

fuse.name: SPARE_REG0_SECURE
fuse.description: This fuse determines if the corresponding OEM spare region is treated as secure. If blown, it indicates secure, and the region has the properties of a customer private key, and is not readable through SW while debug is enabled.

fuse.name: SPARE_REG1_SECURE
fuse.description: This fuse determines if the corresponding OEM spare region is treated as secure. If blown, it indicates secure, and the region has the properties of a customer private key, and is not readable through SW while debug is enabled.

fuse.name: SPARE_REG2_SECURE
fuse.description: This fuse determines if the corresponding OEM spare region is treated as secure. If blown, it indicates secure, and the region has the properties of a customer private key, and is not readable through SW while debug is enabled._x000D_ * This region is reserved for DOLBY and will be blown by QC.

fuse.name: SPARE_REG3_SECURE
fuse.description: This fuse determines if the corresponding OEM spare region is treated as secure. If blown, it indicates secure, and the region has the properties of a customer private key, and is not readable through SW while debug is enabled._x000D_ * This region is reserved for DOLBY and will be blown by QC.

fuse.name: EKU_ENFORCEMENT_EN
fuse.description: When this fuse is blown will enable enforcement of the EKU field in the certificate.

fuse.name: DISABLE_RSA
fuse.description: When this bit is 0 and signed image type is SHA384 + RSA/ECC is 0 => RSA OPERATION_x000D_ When this bit is 0 and signed image type is SHA384 + RSA/ECC IS 1=> ECC OPERATION USING PKA IP_x000D_ When this bit is 1 and signed image type is SHA384 + RSA/ECC is 0 => Error_x000D_ When this bit is 1 and signed image type is SHA384 + RSA/ECC IS 1=> ECC OPERATION USING PKA IP.

fuse.name: OEM_HW_ID
fuse.description: The OEM hardware ID. Bits 15:0.

fuse.name: OEM_PRODUCT_ID
fuse.description: The OEM product ID. Bits 15:0.

fuse.name: PERIPH_PID
fuse.description: Overrides the default Qti device ID. Both PERIPH_VID and PERIPH_PID need blown to a non-zero value to take effect.

fuse.name: PERIPH_VID
fuse.description: Overrides the default Qti vendor ID. Both PERIPH_VID and PERIPH_PID need blown to a non-zero value to take effect.

fuse.name: ANTI_ROLLBACK_FEATURE_EN
fuse.description: Bit 0 - BOOT_ANTI_ROLLBACK_EN_x000D_ Bit 1 - TZAPPS_ANTI_ROLLBACK_EN_x000D_ Bit 2 - PILSUBSYS_ANTI_ROLLBACK_EN_x000D_ Bit 3 - MSA_ANTI_ROLLBACK_EN_x000D_ Bit 4 - Reserved_x000D_ Bit 5 - Reserved_x000D_ Bit 6 - Reserved_x000D_ Bit 7 - Reserved.

fuse.name: COMMON_MAC_VENDOR_INFO
fuse.description: Captures the 24Bit Vendor information which is vendor specific and attached to the offset to form the complete MAC Address.

fuse.name: MAC_START_ADDR_OFFSET
fuse.description: Start Offset of the MAC Address that is to be used.

fuse.name: NO_OF_MACS
fuse.description: Range of MAC address from Start offset.

fuse.name: MASK_FOR_MACS
fuse.description: This is the Mask to indicate which of the Ethx to be skipped where x = 1 to 32. Bit0 corresponds to Eth1.

fuse.name: MRC_HASH
fuse.description: Hash of Multiple Root Certificates (up to 4 certificates).

fuse.name: FEC_125
fuse.description: FEC autocalculated based on 56 bits in the row.

fuse.name: FEC_126
fuse.description: FEC autocalculated based on 56 bits in the row.

fuse.name: FEC_127
fuse.description: FEC autocalculated based on 56 bits in the row.

fuse.name: FEC_128
fuse.description: FEC autocalculated based on 56 bits in the row.

fuse.name: FEC_129
fuse.description: FEC autocalculated based on 56 bits in the row.

fuse.name: FEC_130
fuse.description: FEC autocalculated based on 56 bits in the row.

fuse.name: FEC_131
fuse.description: FEC autocalculated based on 56 bits in the row.

fuse.name: FEC_132
fuse.description: FEC autocalculated based on 56 bits in the row.

fuse.name: FEC_133
fuse.description: FEC autocalculated based on 56 bits in the row.

fuse.name: OEM_PRODUCT_SEED
fuse.description: OEM Product Seed is generated by the OEM and written to SoC fuses. The seed value is used by the OEM to derive device provisioning keys that are specific to the OEM product. This value is protected by TME HW and is only readable by TME HW in the context of key derivation operations.

fuse.name: FEC_128
fuse.description: FEC autocalculated based on 56 bits in the row.

fuse.name: FEC_129
fuse.description: FEC autocalculated based on 56 bits in the row.

fuse.name: FEC_130
fuse.description: FEC autocalculated based on 56 bits in the row.

fuse.name: OEM_SPARE_3
fuse.description: Spare fuses provided for OEM specific use case, OEM Can blow fuse value according to their requirement.
